lexUnit.name: gift.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a thing given willingly to someone without payment; a present.

sentence.text: But her response to my gift was disappointingly subdued .
Jacob 's gift , and Esau 's acceptance of it , seal the reconciliation .
` It was Luke 's gift to me , " she said .
When she received a gift from the Queensland corps back in Australia she used it to help Simon .
Anyway , the badge was a gift from Labour 's leading tortoise-fancier , Tony Banks .
Her husband found her one day wearing a rose pinned to her gown that was not from his garden , and guessed it was a gift from her lover .
The statue had been a gift from Maude , one of the few presents she had received from her sister .
And when Nicole , looking radiant , was asked if the clothing was , perhaps , a gift for a friend who was expecting , she glanced shyly away .
However , knowing that the box was a personal gift by one of the Gilberts to the other , it does emphasise the private character of this otherwise magnificent collection .
It was Martha who finally made the decision to accept Harry 's gift .
Each suggestor will receive a small gift for submitting their idea .
As your wedding gifts arrive , send out thank you letters
He bought wonderful gifts for his family from Harrods in London .
Whether you 're searching for an unusual birthday gift , designer suit , engagement ring , leather luggage or simply to eat , York is the place to go .
I handed over a plethora of retirement gifts from her colleagues and wished her a long and happy retirement .
Her personal wedding gift to her son was a magnificent carpet which was spread in the small majlis , a room in the tahat or sitting down tradition with cushions lining the walls .
This was Nahum 's wedding gift to his bride .
She told me that he just had time to wrap a small gift of appreciation .
